sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: There is a predefined class called anyclass, which is the root of the expansion tree. All classes that do not have inherit lists are considered to be expansions of anyclass. The main purpose of anyclass is to allow pointers that can locate objects of any class.
sections.mdown_content: There is a predefined class called **anyclass**, which is the root of the expansion tree. All classes that do not have **inherit** lists are considered to be expansions of **anyclass**. The main purpose of **anyclass** is to allow pointers that can locate objects of any class.

sections.title: Example
code:
var p : pointer to anyclass     % Short form: var p : ^ anyclass
        var q : pointer to stack        % Short form: var q : ^ stack
        new q               % Create a stack object
        p := q              % Legal because p's class
                            % is an ancestor of q's class
p -> push (14)      % ILLEGAL!  anyclass has no operations
q := p  % Checks that p locates a stack object (or descendant)
stack (p) . push (14)   % Checks that p locates a stack object

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: It is legal to create objects of the class called anyclass, but this is not of much use, because there is nothing you can do with these objects (they have no operations). It is legal to assign these objects to other objects of the same class (anyclass), although this accomplishes nothing.
